video.title: Day in the life of a PayPal software engineer
video.description:
Learn what it is like to work at PayPal in this day in the life of a software engineer. Shruti Kapoor shares what she does in a normal day. The PayPal office shown is in San Jose, California.

Also, PayPal is hiring!

🐦Shurti on Twitter: https://twitter.com/shrutikapoor08

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Grey Sindrome
topLevelComment.text:
This doesn't reflect in anyway the life of a SWE at PayPal. I myself am a recent hire out of uni and my team's routine is very packed. Not denying that there are other teams with relatively lesser hours spent on productive work. But let me iterate on the fact that she is definitely not the right indication for the kind of work a SWE does at PayPal everyday. Not even close.

As other commenters have pointed out and we all internally know that such candidates are a clear diversity hire. No one can even bring such things up the management as they will turn on them saying we are being gender biased with our opinions(go figure).

All these candidates do is get a degree from yet another uni, go online and learn how to do front end design in a week, read some crap about management books, dress up and talk like they know it all, get the job, go give random talks at conferences saying that they are experts in the field. With a bit of search I found that this person is on the design team but there is not even one significant contribution other than random stack overflow copy pastes and what-the-heck conference talks.

I sincerely feel very bad seeing this. PayPal has a lot of amazing people(women and men) doing phenomenal work in the industry. And this video doesn't reflect even a tiny bit of the works being done by hard working and smart engineers we have here at PayPal.

replies.author: shalini sil
replies.text: Probably PayPal and fcc got together to promote their office culture as they all do. Promote that they care about their employees and staff. Your management will fire you upon calling an employee a diversity hire because you *are* a gender-biased person. And how would you know about her contributions? Company work is almost never OS until mentioned otherwise.

topLevelComment.author: Akash Nag
topLevelComment.text: As the name suggests stand up meeting is done standing up.

replies.author: Lord Lobov
replies.text: At IBM we have to stand up because our meeting rooms can't afford to have chairs

replies.author: Alex Curtis
replies.text: I've had a lot of "stand up meetings" with everyone sitting around a conference room table. The concept of it being a "standup meeting" is that its supposed to be very fast.  The goal isn't to go into details or spend a lot of time, so there is no need to sit down, and standing up forces people to keep it brief. Basically just giving everyone on the team a headsup of what their teammates are doing and allows a platform to voice anything thats slowing you down, and then going back to work.

replies.author: ankur agarwall
replies.text: We do it sitting down on our chairs over Skype. Always need to remind someone to sit down for stand up
